algorithm_technique: Check if minimum element is >= k. If so, count unique elements greater than k. Otherwise, impossible.
problem_summary_simple: Make all array elements equal to k using operations that set larger elements to a valid 'h'.
problem_summary_technical: An operation sets elements > h to h, where elements > h are identical. To reach k, the minimum element must be >= k. Operations reduce unique values greater than k.
key_insights: The 'valid h' condition implies that at any step, all elements greater than the chosen 'h' must be the same value.
To make all elements equal to k, the minimum element in the array must be greater than or equal to k.
Each operation effectively reduces the number of distinct values greater than the target k by one, by setting them to a smaller valid 'h'.
